Description: Tondo sherd of Attic black-figured pottery short-stemmed cup with top parts of foot; narrow, flaring foot (stand surface lost) with moulding at waist; interior glazed black with tondo reserved; black-figure decoration consisting of crude Gorgoneion (high arched eyebrows, eyes with solid black irises and thin outlines, black blob for nose, black mouth with added red blob for tongue (no teeth, tusks, or ears), alternating red and black blobs for locks on forehead, incised lines on beard); underside of foot reserved with central dot, circle and band; inside and outside of foot glazed; added red band on moulding..
Curator's comments: Compare the plate Athens, Agora P 25316 in Agora XXIII, pl. 96 no. 1406 and the stemless cups Athens, Agora P 5687 in Agora XXIII, pl. 114, no. 1786; Athens, Agora P 7095 in Agora XXIII, pl. 114, no. 1789 and Athens, Agora P 7137 in Agora XXIII, pl. 114, no. 1790.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B600.9)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0677) (Phase 1)
